title: Ticket #6133: Improve syntax of remote_cerequirements
description:
remote_cerequirements is used in the OSG by sysadmins of non-condor backends to control job attributes that aren't in the list of first class attributes like mem, cpu, disk, queue. For example, our current JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS has the following expression: 

eval_set_remote_cerequirements = strcat(ifThenElse(default_remote_cerequirements isnt undefined, strcat(string(default_remote_cerequirements), " && "), ""), \\
      ifThenElse(maxWallTime isnt undefined, strcat("Walltime == ", string(60*maxWallTime), " && CondorCE == 1"), \\
          ifThenElse(default_maxWallTime isnt undefined, strcat("Walltime == ", string(60*default_maxWallTime), " && CondorCE == 1"), \\
            "CondorCE == 1")))

And the blahp uses the evaluated definition of Walltime as the value for the $Walltime variable for a shell script, whose output is included in the JDL that the blahp produces: 

if [ -n "$Walltime" ]; then
  echo "#PBS -l walltime=$Walltime"
#else
#  echo "#PBS -l walltime=24:00:00"
fi

You can see above that the remote_cerequirements expression above is painful with just two variables. Adding more variables to the expression quickly becomes unmanageable.
remarks:
2017-Feb-08 11:21:14 by blin:
This is more relevant today because of ANL's interest in HTCondor-CE and the customizations that they will require.

2017-Feb-08 16:28:46 by jfrey:
Instead of the goofy ClassAd expression in CERequirements, we'd like a simple list of name,value pairs that get passed to the blahp batch submit script. We'd probably use a new attribute name in the job ad for this list.

There are a few ideas for how this attribute's value would be formatted:

  1. String containing name/value pairs, formatted similarly to the Environment attribute
  2. A nested ClassAd whose attributes and evaluated values are the name/value pairs
  3. A list of attribute names, identifying job ad attributes whose names and evaluated values should be used.

During the OSG-FW 2/8/17 call, it should be noted that the Brians were in favor of option 3.

2017-Sep-08 12:00:21 by jfrey:
Ticket #5047 (now abandoned) proposes option 2 in preceding list of formats for a new attribute.

2017-Oct-04 16:13:15 by jfrey:
I've committed code that supports both option 2 (nested ad with name/value pairs) and option 3 (string list of names to be looked up in job ad). Along with the changes in #6422, the example in this ticket can be replaced with one of the following sets of Job Router rules:

String form: 

set_CondorCE = 1
set_WallTime = maxWalltime
set_CERequirements = "Walltime,CondorCE"

Nested ClassAd form: 

set_CERequirements = [ CondorCE = 1; Walltime = maxWalltime ]

Note: I'm exploiting that in the blahp, if a value in CERequirements isn't a string or integer, it's left out of the local_submit_attributes.sh file.
